title: Q3 Checkpoint: Polygons & Circles
description: Cumulative quarterly assessment covering Units 5-6: polygon angle sums, properties of parallelograms, rectangles, rhombi, squares, trapezoids, circle fundamentals, arc length, sector area, inscribed angles, and circle theorems.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: (n-2)×180° for interior sum, 360°/n for each exterior, working backwards from angle
Parallelogram hierarchy, opposite sides/angles congruent, consecutive supplementary, diagonal properties for each type
SAS/ASA + CPCTC with shared diagonals, proving sides/angles congruent from parallelogram properties
Midsegment = (b₁+b₂)/2, isosceles base angles congruent, kite properties
C=2πr=πd, A=πr², vocabulary (radius, diameter, chord, secant, tangent, arc)
A=πr² (uses r²), working backwards from A to find r
Inscribed = half central, semicircle corollary (90°), inscribed quad opposite supplementary
Tangent⊥radius, tangent-chord angle = half intercepted arc

assessmentProblems.question: Find the sum of interior angles of a nonagon (9 sides).
Each interior angle of a regular polygon is 135°. How many sides does it have?
In parallelogram JKLM, JK = 4x + 3 and LM = 6x - 11. Find x and JK.
The diagonals of a rhombus are 16 and 30. Find the side length and perimeter.
A trapezoid has parallel sides of 9 cm and 15 cm. Find the length of the midsegment.
A circle has radius 11 m. Find the circumference and area in terms of π.
Find the area of a circle with diameter 18 inches. Leave your answer in terms of π.
A circle has radius 12 cm. Find the arc length for a central angle of 150°.
An inscribed angle measures 48°. Find the measure of its intercepted arc.
A sector has a central angle of 60° and the circle has radius 9. Find the sector area in terms of π.
Quadrilateral ABCD is inscribed in a circle. If ∠B = 110°, find ∠D.

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Congruence): Given ∠A ≅ ∠D, AC ≅ DF, and ∠C ≅ ∠F. Name the congruence postulate that proves △ABC ≅ △DEF.
spiralReview.answer: ASA (two angles and the included side between them).

spiralReview.question: SPIRAL (Special Right Triangles): In a 45-45-90 triangle, the hypotenuse is 10. Find each leg.
